review.des: Really delicious lunch-sweet potato salad & salmon with brussels sprouts & plum dessert!  The flavors are incredible! Highly recommend this west loop gem!  Cannot wait to go back for dinner & try the wine!

Salt cod with olive oil paired with bread and the bacon wrapped chorizo dates were all we got. Plus a drink and we were stuffed. Shared a panna cotta for dessert.

I was surprised that between the two of us we only needed two dishes to be full. The dishes were pretty rich and delicious. I'd highly recommend this place. They won a James Beard award.

pics.caption: Cod cheese and bacon wrapped dates

review.des: O m g! That bacon wrapped chorizo dates! Comes with 4 pieces and is sooooooo good! I wish it came in 6 pieces! Served with bread and marinara-like sauce. The chorizo was spicy so it was extra good. The lamb neck is delicious with a balance of apples & hummus. When I read "lamb neck," I thought it'd be such chewy tendon-like meat but it was very tender and seemed like it's been cooked a long time on low heat. Reminded me similar to pork shank, but of course a different type of meat. Then had the infamous paella. Came with 3 pieces of shrimp, 2 pieces of chicken, 3 pieces of chorizo. The rice is cooked on the paella pan. It was extra crispy on the bottom so if you like crispy rice, this is it! The rice has all the soaked flavor of seafood so without eating shrimp, the rice itself is good.
This is one of the best all around restaurants in Chicago. Very inventive menu, great service, and I am a big fan of the communal seating. Lastly they're open late!

This is probably my favorite restaurant in Chicago. I had made reservations and was promptly seated by a very friendly waitress. I ordered an Armagnac with their renowned chorizo stuffed bacon wrapped dates. The piquillo pepper sauce had the right amount of seasoning and heat that complemented the protein exquisitely well. I also had the pizza which was very good. The lemon provided a vibrancy that added another dimension in addition to the slow heat from the lightly sprinkled red pepper flakes. Further, I had their Syrah which paired well with the pizza. If you're in the Chi Town area, definitely make your way to Avec to try their chorizo stuffed dates! Literally came from Boston for it and it did not disappoint.

Unfortunately nothing special. The sitting arrangements are truly problematic -we were there for 1 hour and had to stand up from our seats at least 3 different times to let people in and out.

The food is not bad but not good either. We had multiple dishes and by the end I was still waiting for one we liked. Very disappointing.

Yes, avec earns 5 stars. My experience might have been impacted by the delicious bottle(s) of wine we ordered, and the delightful company, but also, it. was. de-licious.

The place: Even though we felt a little bit like we were on Noah's Ark, and I might have gotten bumped by the door a few times while waiting for the rest of my party to arrive, there was something incredibly cozy, familiar, almost familial about this place. I don't normally love the communal seating, and it was a little inconvenient when we had to use the restroom, but we made it work, and it was totally manageable.

The taste: Everything that I ate, I'd eat again today, tomorrow, you name it. I didn't have the bruschetta with cured ham or the bacon wrapped dates, which I've heard amazing things about, but my crew seemed to enjoy them. I did eat the brussels sprouts (YUM), the focaccia with tallegio (YUM YUM), the lemon bucatini (solid. tasty), the charred cabbage (mmmmm). We shared the citrus pavlova for dessert. And 2 bottles of the Indalia pinot noir - that was a fantastic bottle of wine, IMO.

My face: A little flushed from the wine, though I stopped after not too much since I had to drive us home. A little radiant because someone who wasn't me picked up the whole tab for the 4 of us. Dinner for 4 with one bottle of wine, pre-tip was $170; the bottle of wine I bought at the bar before was another $50 I think.

This is a place to go if you want to catch up, laugh, impress someone, and/or eat very well. Make reservations if you can. It's small, but still is a venue that can make for some big memories.

We've wanted to visit for quite some time and finally had the opportunity to do so before a concert. We made reservations, however we chose to sit at the bar. It seemed as if we sat at a table, we'd have to squeeze in between others and I just wasn't content with that. Not sure I made the right choice though, the bar was pretty cramped as well.
We had a variety of things but my favorites were the oysters, the bacon wrapped dates and of course the espresso cookie.
The food came flying out at such a pace, we barely had room for the plates at our cramped little spot & the wait service was slightly slow.. it's pretty evident when the bar backs poured my wine & removed empty plates.
The food was better than average though, so that's a plus. If asked, I'd go back again but won't really go out of my way to make another reservation.

Fantastic meal! Created my own three course meal with an appetizer of the chorizo stuffed dates wrapped in bacon, main course with pork shoulder, and desert with the olive oil brownie with lemon sorbet and Greek yogurt. This meal certainly DID NOT suck, one of the best meals I have had in Chicago. The spice of the chorizo was complimented well with the sweetness of the date and saltiness of the bacon. Pork shoulder was extremely tender and flavor simply out of this world. Dessert capped off the already delicious meal well with an outstanding lemon flavor and soft brownie. Will certainly be bringing friends to this restaurant and highly recommend!

I booked this place for bday celebration not realizing their seating arrangements.  We were seated at corner right at the entrance.  I felt cold but the hostess helped with the heater which was readily available right next to me!  Hummm

Anyway food was delicious, we ordered cheese platter oddly assortments have to be ordered separately, we did and the wildflower honey yum!!! ...   my favorite!  

We had a whole fish, oysters, chicken and chef special cheese toast which was almost like a burrata on toast.

Overall it was a fun experience!!

What can I say that hasn't been said before? Probably  not much! This place is worth it!  I was little turned off when I  first I walked in bc  the space is tiny but i quickly forgot about that when the food started coming! Everything we had was absolutely delicious! Specially the stuffed dates and the pork shoulder!!

The place is tiny, the noise level can be quite loud at times.  When we were seated we were seated at a communal table, it was a bit awkward because we seated in the middle of two parties and had to ask one party to let us in.   There were times where our neighboring party was so loud that I was unable to hear the person in front of me.  
The food on the other hand was magnificent.  We had to try the bacon wrapped dates... OMG they were beyond what I was expecting.  The bronzino was cooked to perfection.

I came here with co-workers for a birthday lunch during Restaurant Week, and we still ordered the Chorizo Stuffed Dates in addition to the pre-fixe menu. I mean it's a pretty genius idea taking the classic bacon wrapped dates onto another level with the chorizo. I loved the take on the Quinoa Tabouleh, too. I appreciated how more complex and dense this was with the spiced walnuts. The lamb burger was so juicy and flavorful, and the creme fraiche panna cotta was the perfect ending to the meal. I wish I could eat like this every day. The service was great as my water got continually filled and plates were taken to make space and our food arrived pretty timely.

Everything was delicious. Loved the squash blossom pizza, the simple tomato sauce with the egg and cheese was just great. The cherry tomato literally exploded in my mouth like a juicy, flavorful, fresh bomb of deliciousness. Also the avec burger was great, loved the sauce, combined with juicy patty and soft bun. The werp farm greens was fresh and crunchy but a little too salty for us. Overall great restaurant! Will come back again.

review.des:
The review is 3.5 stars. I really wanted to love this place since the chefs and servers were so kind but the it factor just wasn't there for me. Everything was good but I wouldn't say amazing or that I'm a fan. We tried three dishes: chorizo stuffed medjool dates, deluxe focaccia with taleggio cheese, and grilled sausage with charred strawberry and starwberry tzatziki sauce. The chorizo stuffed medjool dates were solid but the tomato sauce they were overpowered the dates and was very salty. The bread served with the dates was out of place and wasn't good. The focaccia was good but a bit overpowering but it tasted better once we drizzled it with honey to balance the pungent taste of the cheese. The grilled sausage with charred strawberry and strawberry tzatziki sauce was supposed to the most interesting dish to try but I couldn't even taste the strawberry in the greek sauce.

I would come here for drinks though. The meztropolis drink was amazing, citrusy, and smooth.
